Celebs React To Johnny Depp Winning $7 Million Settlement Against Amber!

INTRO: Johnny Depp finally gets a win after the consistent losses against his now ex-wife Amber Heard. But of course, the Pirates off the Caribbean actor didn’t win it alone the lawsuit but with the help of the mounting number of celebrities backing him up. So, what do they have to say?

The very long and tough divorce proceeding has finally reached new heights when the actor Johnny Depp and his legal team seized an opportunity when actress Amber Heard claims that she did truly donate all of the seven million dollars of Depp's settlement money to charity. The opportunity presented gave Depp a breakthrough in their persistent efforts to prove that the money is indeed not going any near to the charity she claimed. But his win only started to see the light of day when a New York court decision was in favor of the actor, effectively validating Johnny Depp's petition request. His appeal would mean mean that the ACLU will now have to submit documentation papers proving that Amber Heard gave the money she claimed to donate, to the charitorganization. Johnny Depp didn’t celebrate this victory alone, fans were ecstatic hearing this news, and his lawyers finally breath a sigh of relief, all considering the court ruling a win for Depp. This was a breakthrough in the expensive divorce procedure in both the United States and England especially after his defeat in the United Kingdom against the lawsuit he filed against The Sun. As most of you may know, Dep suffered from a staggering loss against the tabloid company in a defamation suit in November, when the publishing company labeled him in their 2018 headlines as a “wife-beater”, undoubtedly angering Depp. The headlines caught eyes of thousands of people since it was because Heard accused Depp in Los Angeles in 2016 for abusing the actress. The famous tabloid and the editor of the news won the case in the end, considering that the “victim” Amber Heard was their number one witness forcing the High court of London to give the win to the company. The judge also took into account that most, if not all, of Heard’s sexual harassment claims said in the news published by the company, checked out. After losing the law suit, it was time to go back home to America for the divorcees.


The dispute was continued in Virginia where Depp made the claims in an interview that, “She was the perpetrator, and I was the victim”, he continues saying “While mixing prescription amphetamines and non-prescription drugs with alcohol, Heard hit, punched and kicked me. She also repeatedly and frequently threw objects into my body, head, including heavy bottles, soda cans, burning candles, television remote controls and paint thinner cans, which severely injured me”. And the claims were not so easily shaken off by the public when a recording taken by Depp reveals the actress owning up to her mistake and apologizing, somehow, you be the judge of that. “Okay I’m sorry I hit you, I did mean to hit you but t was in response I just reacted in response to my foot. I just reacted and I’m sorry, it’s below me”. Well, whether Amber meant it or not, it didn’t matter to fans, and celebrities like Sia. The forty-five-year-old musician took her opinions on the matter to Twitter and defended Johnny tweeting “Just showing my public support for Johnny Depp. I mean, I’d just love him to get clean and stop with the jewelry, but he is clearly the victim after hearing those tapes”.

The 50 million dollar defamation trial of Johnny against his ex-wife, Amber has been postponed to 11th April 2022 which means that we have one more year of listening to this drama. Now, we all know that the case started in confusion and most of us didn’t know who was telling the truth but as it continues to unfold, many people are slowly realizing who the actual victim is. Amber asked her former employee to lie under oath
Many people have come forward to accuse Amber Heard of being a pathological liar. Apart from Johnny Depp’s lawyer, David Sherborne, who called Amber Heard an unreliable witness and a compulsive liar, Johnny and Amber’s former employees have also come forward to expose just how far Amber’s dishonesty can go. Kevin Murphy, Johnny Depp’s former estate manager said that Amber Heard asked him to lie under oath after she was charged with bringing her two dogs to Australia illegally in May 2015. Murphy went on to say:

She wanted me to say essentially that it was my fault in one way or another that the paperwork wasn’t completed so that I could take the blame for her.

A lawyer then asked Murphy why he didn’t go to Mr. Depp to ask him to intervene and this is what Murphy had to say:

Because Amber wielded a lot of power and would have made my life miserable.

Amber pocketed her 7 million dollar divorce settlement
In 2016, Amber received a 7 million dollar divorce settlement from Johnny Depp. She then pledged to give the entire sum to charity. She in fact released a statement saying:

As described in the restraining order and divorce settlement, money played no role for me personally and never has, except to the extent that I could donate it to charity and, in doing so, hopefully, help those less able to defend themselves. As reported in the media, the amount received in the divorce was 7 million dollars, and 7 million dollars is being donated.

Amber was supposed to donate half of that money to the American Civil Liberties Union Foundation and the other half to the children’s hospital in Los Angeles. However, Johnny recently made claims that Amber kept the 7 million dollar settlement that she had promised to give to charity. The ACLU refused to comment on whether they received any money from Amber Heard but the L A’s children’s hospital has brought documents that show that the hospital has received one hundred thousand dollars which is a far cry from the promised 3.5 million dollars.

Amber’s legal team was also forced to admit that to this day, Amber hasn’t given the 7 million dollars she pledged to give to charity in 2016 claiming that Amber has already been responsible for seven figures in donations to charitable causes and intends to continue to contribute and eventually fulfill her pledge.

Amber faked her injuries.
In May 2016, Amber was photographed with visible bruising on her face while making a court appearance. She claimed at the time that the bruises were from an attack by Johnny. . She used this story to get a restraining order against Johnny Depp. However, according to the court documents filed by Johnny in 2019, not only had Amber lied about him physically hurting her, but she also went as far as to fake her bruises for her highly publicized court appearance. Johnny’s statement read:

I have denied Ms. Heard’s allegations vehemently since she first made them in May 2016 when she walked into court to obtain a temporary restraining order with painted-on bruises that witnesses and surveillance footage showed she did not possess each day of the preceding week.

Heard and her allies have given evidence in multiple legal cases saying Depp hurled a phone at her face and trashed their penthouse kitchen during the notorious May 2016 dust-up.

But the actor's lawyers claim the lurid depictions of damage - including broken candelabras, glass strewn on the floor and red wine sloshed on the walls and carpets - are completely at odds with what police remember.

Four different LAPD officers visited the stylish, loft-style apartment in downtown Los Angeles within the space of two hours after Heard's pals mistakenly dialed 911 twice.

The first two cops have given new depositions within the past month reiterating that they swept the $1.5 million property but didn't see any injuries, vandalism or evidence of a crime.

DailyMail.com can also reveal for the first time footage from a second set of responding officers who had cameras on as they entered Heard and Depp's former marital home later that night.

Their body-worn devices reveal a tidy hallway leading to an elegant kitchen and living area adorned with ornaments, fresh flowers, piles of books, numerous candles and candelabras.

The officers don't appear to spot anything suspicious, however, and there are no obvious signs of damage, disarray or staining to the floors or carpets in the three and a half minute videos.

Depp's attorney Adam Waldman says the footage proves there was never any wrecking spree and that Heard's account of the evening cannot be trusted.

'Amber Heard and her friends described a chaotic, messy crime scene but the newly released LAPD bodycam videos unambiguously show that the penthouse was utterly undamaged and that their testimony was one more grandiose lie,' Waldman told DailyMail.com in a statement.

The former couple are preparing to square off again in Fairfax County, Virginia, where Depp is suing his 34-year-old ex-wife for $50 million over a Washington Post op-ed in which she described herself as a domestic violence survivor.

Justice Nicol ruled that the depiction was 'substantially true' and that father-of-two Depp had attacked Heard a dozen times, causing her to fear for her life on three occasions.

The May 21, 2016 incident was included in the catalogue of abuse after Heard gave graphic testimony describing how her former beau hurled a phone in her face and tore out clumps of her hair.

The confrontation was said to have taken place inside penthouse 3 of the swank Eastern Columbia building, where Depp once owned an entire floor of five neighboring apartments, accessed via a private elevator.

After Depp's security team broke up the fight he went into penthouse 5, where Heard kept some of her stuff, to 'ransack' her possessions and cause further damage before finally leaving the building, it was claimed.

The Aquaman star's lawyers provided the court with time-stamped 'crime scene' images, including smashed photo frames, broken glass and wine spilled across hardwood floor and carpets.

snippet.title: Amber Heard podría ir a la cárcel por mentir sobre Johnny Depp
snippet.description:
La batalla legal entre Johnny Depp y Amber Heard continúa. Después de que la actriz asegurara en 2018 que había sido víctima de violencia física y verbal durante su matrimonio, parece que ahora es ella la que podría acabar en prisión.

Según el International Business Times, Heard podría enfrentarse a una pena de hasta tres años de prisión por falsificar pruebas contra Depp.

La intérprete afirmó que tenía moratones en los ojos la noche antes de aparecer en The Late Late Show con James Corden en 2015.

Sin embargo, la estilista de Heard, Samantha McMillen, declaró que la actriz no tenía ninguna lesión.

Durante el día 16 de diciembre de 2015 pude ver claramente que Amber Heard no tenía marcas visibles, contusiones, cortes o lesiones en la cara o cualquier otra parte de su cuerpo", apuntó.

El Código Penal de California declaró que es ilegal alterar, modificar, plantar, colocar, ocultar, fabricar o mover cualquier prueba física con la intención de hacer que alguien sea acusado de un delito. El ofrecimiento y preparación de pruebas falsas se consideran delitos graves y conllevan una pena máxima de hasta tres años", señala la publicación.

Por su parte, Depp asegura haber escuchado que su exmujer se había "pintado moretones" para conseguir una orden de alejamiento.

Ambos comenzaron el proceso de divorcio en agosto de 2016, trámite que finalizó en enero de 2017.

Sin embargo, en diciembre de 2018, Heard escribió un artículo de opinión para el Washington Post en el que habló del maltrato que supuestamente sufrió durante su relación con Depp. Poco después el actor presentó una demanda por difamación de 50 millones millones de dólares contra ella.

snippet.title: Depp, Heard arrive for third day of UK libel trial
snippet.description:
(9 Jul 2020) DEPP, HEARD ARRIVE FOR THIRD DAY OF UK LIBEL TRIAL
Actor Johnny Depp and his ex-wife, actress Amber Heard arrived at the High Court in London on Thursday (9 July 2020) for the third day of a three-week trial over his libel case against a British newspaper.
Depp is suing News Group Newspapers, publisher of The Sun, and the paper’s executive editor, Dan Wootton, over an April 2018 article that said he’d physically abused ex-wife Amber Heard. 
The newspaper's lawyers plan to use Heard's allegations of abuse by Depp to defend the “wife beater” claim.
The trial opened on Tuesday. 
It is one of the first major cases to be held in person since Britain began to lift its coronavirus lockdown.
Depp, 57, and Heard, 34, met on the set of the 2011 comedy “The Rum Diary” and married in Los Angeles in February 2015. They divorced in 2017 and now bitterly accuse one another of abuse.
While Heard isn't on trial, the case is also a showdown between the former spouses, who accuse each other of being controlling, violent and deceitful.
It is set to put the two performers’ complex private lives under a microscope.
Depp is also suing Heard in the United States for 50 million US dollars for allegedly defaming him in a Washington Post article about domestic abuse. 
That case is due to be heard next year.
